geotorch
0.0.1

Introduction:

  • Introduction

Manifolds:

  • Real vector space: \(\mathbb{R}^n\)
  • Symmetric Matrices: \(\operatorname{Sym}(n)\)
  • Skew-symmetric Matrices: \(\operatorname{Skew}(n)\)
  • Sphere: \(\mathbb{S}^n\)
  • Special Orthogonal Group: \(\operatorname{SO}(n)\)
  • Stiefel Manifold: \(\operatorname{St}(n,k)\)
  • Grassmannian Manifold: \(\operatorname{Gr}(n,k)\)
  • Variety of Low Rank Matrices: \(\operatorname{LowRank}(n,k,r)\)

Constructions:

  • Product Manifold: \(M_1 \times \dots \times M_k\)
geotorch
  • Docs »
  • geotorch package

class geotorch.AbstractManifold(dimensions, size)[source]¶

Initializes internal Module state, shared by both nn.Module and ScriptModule.

To print customized extra information, you should reimplement this method in your own modules. Both single-line and multi-line strings are acceptable.

class geotorch.Manifold(dimensions, size)[source]¶

Initializes internal Module state, shared by both nn.Module and ScriptModule.

forward(X)[source]¶

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

trivialization(X, B)[source]¶

Parametrizes the manifold in terms of a tangent space :param X: A tensor, usually living in T_B M :type X: torch.Tensor :param B: Point on M at whose tangent space we are trivializing :type B: torch.Tensor

Returns

A tensor on the manifold

Return type

tensor (torch.Tensor)

Note

This function should be surjective, otherwise not all the manifold will be explored

class geotorch.ProductManifold(manifolds)[source]¶

Initializes internal Module state, shared by both nn.Module and ScriptModule.

chain(parametrization)[source]¶

It modifies the current parametrization, parametrizing the original tensor in terms of the new parametrization

The original parametrization is modified after chain is applied to it

Parameters

parametrization (nn.Parametrization) – the parametrization to be chained

Returns

The original module with the parametrization module appended to it

Return type

Module

Note

class geotorch.Grassmannian(size, triv='expm')[source]¶

Grassmannian manifold as a projection from the orthogonal matrices \(\operatorname{St}(n,k)\). The metric considered is the canonical.

Note

This class is equivalent to GrassmannianTall, but it is faster for the case when \(n\) is of a similar size of k. For example, \(n \leq 4k\).

Parameters

  • size (torch.size) – Size of the tensor to be applied to

  • triv (str or callable) – Optional. A map that maps \(\operatorname{Skew}(n)\) onto the orthogonal matrices surjectively. It can be one of [“expm”, “cayley”] or a custom callable. Default: “expm”

extra_repr()[source]¶

Set the extra representation of the module

To print customized extra information, you should reimplement this method in your own modules. Both single-line and multi-line strings are acceptable.

uniform_init_()[source]¶

Samples an orthogonal matrix uniformly at random according to the Haar measure on \(\operatorname{Gr}(n,k)\).

class geotorch.GrassmannianTall(size, triv='expm')[source]¶

Grassmannian manifold parametrized from is tangent space using the orthogonal projection from the ambient space \(\mathbb{R}^{n \times k}\). The metric considered is the canonical.

Note

This class is equivalent to Grassmannian, but it is faster for the case when \(n\) is of a much larger than k. For example, \(n > 4k\).

Parameters

  • size (torch.size) – Size of the tensor to be applied to

  • triv (str or callable) – Optional. A map that maps \(\operatorname{Skew}(n)\) onto the orthogonal matrices surjectively. It can be one of [“expm”, “cayley”] or a custom callable. Default: “expm”

uniform_init_()[source]¶

Samples an orthogonal matrix uniformly at random according to the Haar measure on \(\operatorname{Gr}(n,k)\).

class geotorch.LowRank(size, rank)[source]¶

Variety of the matrices of rank \(r\) or less.

Parameters

  • size (torch.size) – Size of the tensor to be applied to

  • rank (int) – Rank of the matrices. It has to be less than \(\min\(\texttt{size}[-1], \texttt{size}[-2]\)\)

Vector space of unconstrained vectors.

class geotorch.Skew(size, lower=True)[source]¶

Vector space of skew-symmetric matrices, parametrized in terms of the upper or lower triangular part of the matrix.

Parameters

  • size (torch.size) – Size of the tensor to be applied to

  • lower (bool) – Optional. Uses the lower triangular part of the matrix to parametrize the matrix. Default: True

Note

class geotorch.SO(size, triv='expm', lower=True)[source]¶

Manifold of square orthogonal matrices with positive determinant parametrized in terms of its Lie algebra, the skew-symmetric matrices.

Parameters

  • size (torch.size) – Size of the tensor to be applied to

  • triv (str or callable) – Optional. A map that maps \(\operatorname{Skew}(n)\) onto the orthogonal matrices surjectively. It can be one of [“expm”, “cayley”] or a custom callable. Default: “expm”

  • lower (bool) – Optional. Uses the lower triangular part of the matrix to parametrize the skew-symmetric matrices. Default: True

extra_repr()[source]¶

Set the extra representation of the module

To print customized extra information, you should reimplement this method in your own modules. Both single-line and multi-line strings are acceptable.

torus_init_(init_=None, triv=<function expm>)[source]¶

Samples the 2D input tensor as a block-diagonal skew-symmetric matrix which is skew-symmetric in the main diagonal. The blocks are of the form \(\begin{pmatrix} 0 & b \\ -b & 0\end{pmatrix}\) where \(b\) is distributed according to init_. Then it is projected to the manifold using triv.

Note

This initialization is particularly useful for regularizing RNNs.

Parameters

  • init_ – Optional. A function that takes a tensor and fills it in place according to some distribution. See torch.init. Default: \(\operatorname{Uniform}(-\pi, \pi)\)

  • triv – Optional. A function that maps skew-symmetric matrices to orthogonal matrices.

trivialization(X, B)[source]¶

Parametrizes the manifold in terms of a tangent space :param X: A tensor, usually living in T_B M :type X: torch.Tensor :param B: Point on M at whose tangent space we are trivializing :type B: torch.Tensor

Returns

A tensor on the manifold

Return type

tensor (torch.Tensor)

Note

This function should be surjective, otherwise not all the manifold will be explored

uniform_init_()[source]¶

Samples an orthogonal matrix uniformly at random according to the Haar measure on \(\operatorname{SO}(n)\).

class geotorch.Sphere(size, r=1.0)[source]¶

Sphere as a map from the tangent space onto the sphere using the exponential map.

Parameters

  • size (torch.size) – Size of the tensor to be applied to

  • r (float) – Optional. Radius of the sphere. It has to be positive. Default: 1.

extra_repr()[source]¶

Set the extra representation of the module

To print customized extra information, you should reimplement this method in your own modules. Both single-line and multi-line strings are acceptable.

uniform_init_()[source]¶

Samples a point uniformly on the sphere

class geotorch.Stiefel(size, triv='expm')[source]¶

Manifold of rectangular orthogonal matrices parametrized as a projection from the square orthogonal matrices \(\operatorname{SO}(n)\). The metric considered is the canonical.

Note

This class is equivalent to StiefelTall, but it is faster for the case when \(n\) is of a similar size of k. For example, \(n \leq 4k\).

Parameters

  • size (torch.size) – Size of the tensor to be applied to

  • triv (str or callable) – Optional. A map that maps \(\operatorname{Skew}(n)\) onto the orthogonal matrices surjectively. It can be one of [“expm”, “cayley”] or a custom callable. Default: “expm”

extra_repr()[source]¶

Set the extra representation of the module

To print customized extra information, you should reimplement this method in your own modules. Both single-line and multi-line strings are acceptable.

uniform_init_()[source]¶

Samples an orthogonal matrix uniformly at random according to the Haar measure on \(\operatorname{St}(n,k)\).
